Name.label: Rare ophthalmic disorder with cortical involvement

TextSection.Contents: Visual snow syndrome is a rare neurologic disease characterized by persistent continuous bilateral visual experience of flickering snow-like dots throughout the visual field in association with other visual (including palinopsia, enhanced entopic phenomena, nyctalopia, photophobia and photopsia) and non-visual (migraine with or without aura, tinnitus and occasionally tremor) symptoms.
